class.name: DiscordErrorType
class.brief_description: Enum representing various types of errors the SDK returns.

constants.constant: No error, the operation was successful.
The user is offline or there was some network issue that prevented an underlying HTTP call from succeeding.

An HTTP call was made to Discord's servers but a non success HTTP status code was returned. In some cases this may be retryable, and if so <ref refid="classdiscordpp_1_1ClientResult_1a0d220638f4a36c0b8b731f601e0ac02d" kindref="member">ClientResult::Retryable</ref> will be true. In most cases though the failure is due to a validation or permissions error, and the request is not retryable. <ref refid="classdiscordpp_1_1ClientResult_1a3175ab59cd9268a3b2c6484129c89e04" kindref="member">ClientResult::Error</ref> and <ref refid="classdiscordpp_1_1ClientResult_1ab361cb3d3381401f0d73736d5f49b3f5" kindref="member">ClientResult::ErrorCode</ref> will have more information.

An operation such as sending a friend request or joining a lobby was attempted but the [DiscordClient] is not yet ready. Wait for <ref refid="classdiscordpp_1_1Client_1a6f714c5d6aebefa91c1ff8ba97bcce22" kindref="member">Client::Status</ref> to change to <ref refid="classdiscordpp_1_1Client_1a6f714c5d6aebefa91c1ff8ba97bcce22ae7d31fc0602fb2ede144d18cdffd816b" kindref="member">Client::Status::Ready</ref> before trying again. Also be sure to call [DiscordClient] will never become ready.
An operation was temporarily disabled for stability reasons.
The [DiscordClient] has been destroyed and so this operation cannot complete.

Used when an SDK method is called but the inputs don't pass local validation. For example if one attempts to accept a friend request when there is no pending friend request for that user, this <ref refid="namespacediscordpp_1ae19a5aed498bc40359e4d89d14ffb446" kindref="member">ErrorType</ref> would be used. The specific validation error will be included in the [code]error[/code] field, and no other [DiscordClientResult] fields will be set.
The user or developer aborted an operation, such as an authorization flow.
An authorization function failed, but not necessarily as the result of an HTTP call that returned an error.
An RPC call was made to Discord's desktop application, but it returned a non-success result. The error and errorCode fields should both be set with more information.
